result.execSummary:
The defendant Helena B Greenwood was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

No Violent contact with victim. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Obtain a GED/HSED. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent. Case 15CM2372 was dismissed and read in.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Helena B Greenwood

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of failure to meet conditions for expungement. Filed by the DOC.
Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Helena B Greenwood in court with Attorney Kelsey Morin.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jack Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #2.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #2. Count #1 is dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Morin makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #2:  WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR    **Transfer allowed to Milwaukee County**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling-obtain HSED/GED 
____No violent contact with: victim 

COSTS:  $343.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation)

**Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.**

Case called at 9:10 a.m.  Attorney Kelsey Morin in court.   Defendant Helena B Greenwood did not appear.   Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morin does not know why Defendant does not appear today.  Court issues a capias.  Bail is ordered revoked and forfeited.
